pageContext.claim: “This really is an invasion of our country by human traffickers. These are people that are horrible people bringing in women mostly, but bringing in women and children into our country. Human trafficking.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump greatly exaggerates here. There is no invasion of the country, let alone by "human traffickers." There are no specific statistics to show how victims of sex trafficking enter the United States, though experts say many are coerced to enter the country under false pretenses through legal ports of entry such as airports. Smuggling also mostly takes place through ports of entry. The migrant caravans are made up of people seeking asylum in the United States.
